Wanting to know "what comes next", I have already purchased and begun reading the second in the series of books.  I guess that says something about being "involved" with the characters and Ms. Gabaldon's ability to build characters that have depth, even in historical romance.  Being involved with flowers and botany, I was also interested in the main character's "healing" abilities.
I cannot get into this book.  I can't imagine anyone reading every book in the series.

I have read all of Gabaldon's series but OUTLANDER was by far the best. I stumbled upon the book in the library( I am unfortunately one of those people who DO judge a book by it's cover!), brought it home, finished dinner, got the kids to bed and started to read the book at about 8:00 PM. About 5:00 AM, I finally closed the book feeling like I had found a treasure! Claire is a wonderful, smart, down to earth woman who I would love to have as a friend. And Jamie. For the sake of my marriage, I will say no more. These books are a wonderful read! Prepare to be transported

By far the best book I've ever read. I read over 50 books a year. And as an author myself, I truly appreciate a well written book. I do believe this is the best book I've ever read. This author has an incredible style and voice, plus her book premise is unique and adventurous. I mourned having finished the first book, and for the first time ever was glad for the open-ended finish. I couldn't wait to pick up her second book and keep going. I felt like I lived the adventure with the characters, having fallen in love with each one. Thank you, Diana, for a wonderful ride!

I would have given this five stars if I were just judging the writing, which is very good. The first few chapters were so interesting, and the heroine so likable, that I considered going ahead and buying the whole series. Glad I didn't. About halfway through this first book too many passionate matings and bloody clan battles began to get repetitious, and I found myself skipping pages. I finally gave up and skipped to the last chapter, relieved to be finished.  But please judge for yourself. If you are a big fan of time travel and medieval clan history you may like it.
Decent story line, but too much graphic horror and sex and not enough history for me.

I am rereading  The Outlander series all over again. I read this book a couple of years ago and immediately became captivated by the story the hero and heroine and everything  between the pages of this book. I enjoyed them so much that I actually purchased the whole series in hardback, something I never do, I'm too cheap. But I had to be able to read them over and over and share them with friends. I can hardly wait until  Diana Galbadoon writes another, no matter whether its the same series or a brand new one. Her writing style is delicious and my hats off to her.

I started watching Outlander on TV and was totally hooked after the first episode. The actors are great and the story line is exciting; although, I did feel as if I was a voyeur, or watching a porno movie at times; well...I always wanted to view a porno and now I can say I have. I do however, strongly believe the film makers could leave a little to our imaginations. I have since bought the first four books and I have finished Outlander, it did ramble a bit, but I feel it strung out the suspense and made me read faster. I am looking forward to Dragon Fly in Amber.

I have read all of the Outlander series-- repeatedly.  The first book, Outlander, is still my favorite of all of them.  They have everything-- romance, sex, action and above all a GREAT storyline, attention to detail, historical accuracy and a vocabulary that does not insult my intelligence.  Trust me-- if you have somehow managed to go this long without reading this book, get it now.  Every single reader I have loaned this book to has either asked for the next one or started building their own Outlander libray. What are you waiting for?  You won't be sorry!

I have read and reread this series over four times.  Each time I find it captivating, moving, and still exciting.  Gabaldon has painted characters that will live forever.  They are human, with their goodness and faults.  It is one of the most romantic series to come along in a very long time.  Jamie and Claire love each other and through war, a bit of witchcraft, separation and adventure cling to the promise that they made to each other on their wedding day.  I highly recommend this series to anyone who wants a bit of everything in a very well written series.

Late convert! I read the book after the first tv show came out, 20 years late. I really enjoyed it and will recommend it to friends and family. However, I do harbor a disappointment (spoiler alert). There was a time 20 years ago when to make a character especially bad, you make them gay, or to put it more correctly, to make a male character obsessed with abusing other men through all means possible, leading up to rape. It was a reminder of all we've worked to change in the years since. I am very interested to see how the 2014 TV show deals with this issue.

I must admit that this book was given to me as a birthday present and I picked it up a few times and read the back cover and the first page.. but it always ended back up on my shelf.  Not my type of book.  Then out of desperation one night I picked it back up because I had nothing else to read... Wow! Once I got past the first couple of pages and I was sucked in! This is by far the best book I have ever read.  I think I would have gone insane if there was not a series of them.  I read this almost 1000 page book in 4 days.  I think my husband was about ready to divorce me.  I loved every minute of it.  I too was thrown back in time with Claire.  I am praying that this book becomes a movie and that Diana keeps writing books.
Flowing, exquisite writing style and a wonderful story that you never want to end.

I NEVER would have picked up this book... I hate romance novels. A friend gave me the hard cover without the book jacket and I finished it in a day and a half. I gave it to probably 50 people.  My father, from Clan Fraser, grew up in Inverness. The history is fascinating. I've gone on to read pure history about the time and place. The next two books captured me, but the last I didn't especially like. These people should have been killed so many times... it's ridiculous already. Will I read the next two? Of course, but the first was definitely the best!

If I had a choice, I'd give this book an 11.  In this enthralling page-turner, Diana Gabaldon whisks you back in time to Scotland and gives you the ride of your lifetime.  I started this book one summer morning, and read straight through for 9 1/2 hours.  This book is impossible to put down, as you are swept up in the exciting and dangerous lives of Jamie and Claire.  A young woman stumbles through a portal and finds herself back in old Scotland and married to a man with a price on his head.  This book is a spectacular example of what writing should be

I had to read a romance for my book club. After trying two others, I stuck with this one because the writing wasn't terrible. I was okay with this book until the hero, Young Jamie, beats the crap out of the heroine, Claire, after she's almost raped by the villain. Once it got into the whole "he did it because he loves me" bit," and she decides to stay with him instead of returning to her other, non-abusive husband, I could no longer relate to this character. If domestic violence is what passes for romance, I'll stick to my Stephen King novels (wherein domestic abusers are monsters, or eaten by monsters, or both).

I have searched for another book like this one.  There is nothing like it.  Gabaldon weaves a wonderful world of words which you can not resist being swept away in.  The characters are rich and the story is original and wonderful.  Words can not express what an amazing story this is.  After the 5th read of the entire series I keep coming back for more.  The story is simply unparalleled.  I know the last book in the series is coming out this winter and I really don't want the story to end.  I have never met anyone who did not love this book, READ IT

I thought of telling him that his own touch seared my skin and filled my veins with fire."  Who wouldn't dream of love like this?  Outlander is an exceptional read.  Although characterized as a romance, it is so much more.  It is a unique, well-written, richly detailed historical work of fiction, full of fantasy and adventure.  Before I began reading the book, I wondered if I could really get through 850 pages.  The answer is yes - it captured my attention early on and I devoured it within a week! I can't wait to read the rest of the series.
pretty awful

I started by watching the series on Starz but then I couldn't wait to find out what happened next so now I am hooked.  If you love history, romance, and very sexy Scottish men wearing kilts, then this is the book for you.  I personally love the fact that Claire is a strong female character in her own right.  She is a modern day nurse (1945), has a head on her shoulders and is the perfect match for Jamie Fraser.  Although the 800+ pages seems overwhelming, I could not put the book down.  I am already on book 2.  You will not be disappointed!

I was able to buy into the idea of time travel, and I enjoyed the TV series, so I bought the book.  It was, like the TV series, pretty good up to when they got married.  Then, it turned into a "wishful thinking" book of pornography for women.  Endless descriptions of sex, however not just sex, but wildly idealistic sex.  Men might find it educational on what women want, and women might enjoy it, although it will make them unhappy with their existing sex life no matter how good that might be...  Pretty good writing, but overdone characters.

I am writing on all the books in this series. This is a great series of books to start reading. Diana is one of the most engrossing writers, She has a wonderful way of telling a story to make you feel like you are a part of it. You feel the characters in all their ups and downs, you root for them, you dream with them, they become your friends. If you are willing to devote sometime to reading this series, it is so worth it. I read the first 4 books in less than a month. These books are not just books, they become an obsession, I promise.

I read the Drums Of Autumn and decided to start at the beginning with The Outlander.  I'm not a big fan of romance novels, but this book is much more than just romance.  Ms. Gabaldon is a very talented story teller.  Reading her books, I feel like I've been dropped into another world.  There is much of interest in this novel.  The way of life in Scotland in the 1700's, and especially, the medical practices and use of healing herbs.  Bits and pieces of actual history lend a realistic touch.  A very long book, but difficult to put down.

Diana Gabaldon has managed to awaken interests I never knew I had with this series.  Because of this book I've begun alot of research into Scotland and the jacobites as well as the highlanders.  I plan to go there in the near future.  The fantasy of this wonderfully romantic story is one I will never forget and put aside.  Also, if you can get ahold of the unabridged audio series read by Davina Potter- listen to it.  She does so well with all of the accents, and most of all the memorable characters that are throughout this series.

This book was a chore. I very much wanted to fall in love with the series like so many others, but I just couldn't because the main character wouldn't stop making stupid decisions or not acting when she should have. The rest of the characters were constantly doing things out of... character, even Jamie, who was really the only reason I kept reading anyway. It was a mess, the plot dragged on and on, and of course there is very little resolution at the end because you're expected to run out and get the next book. Bleh no thanks.

I think I'm missing something critical here. Everyone I know is obsessed with this show and these books. While this novel isn't bad per se, it certainly is great either. I don't want to spoil anything for anyone but the characters are boring to me. There isn't a whole lot of growth and when ever a character does begin to develop, it seems forced. The plot was also boring and predictable and doesn't make sense to me half the time. I think maybe I went into this with my expectations too high and that is why I'm so disappointed.

I picked up this book because the historical travel aspect of the story appealed to me. I didn't realize I was stumbling into bodice-ripper territory. The sex scenes were way too frequent and way too detailed and way too long---but perhaps they needed to be in order to appeal to the romance fantasy aspect of the readers attracted to this kind of book...The combination of sex and violence sprinkled throughout the story read more like scenes of voyeurism than attempts to provide historical insight or any broader understanding of...well, just about anything. The main character's recovery from the abrupt separation from her husband---of 8 years, I think---was oddly quick and without the level of pain, grief, and anxiety you would expect  given her circumstances. That was a constant puzzle. The woman of 1945 being thrust into the mid-18th century doesn't reflect for too long on the difficulties of having to forgo the basic everyday conveniences of modern civilization, like bathtubs and washing machines. The portrayal of the male villains with gay attractions seemed stereotypical and sprung from a much more homophobic and ignorant perspective than you would expect from an educated, contemporary writer. A wildly popular series that's obviously not for everyone.

Outlander, and the whole series, is a rich, wonderful, thrilling series.  This doesn't belong in the romance section, it needs a section of its own or a special spot in the travel section.  This book has everything; romance, love, hate, action, sex, politics, history, fantasy - ghosts come to life.  The research is impeccable and transports the reader to the Scottish highlands of the 18th century.  I have become one of Diana Gabaldon's rabid fans, all too willingly.  I won't waste time with another synopsis - read and enjoy!

I love the Outlander Series.  I read Outlander for the first time back in the early 90's when it first came out, couldn't wait for the next ones as they came!  I just read A Breath of Snow & Ashes and LOVED it just as much as the others in the series.  NOW I'm kicking myself in the rear!  I had the whole set, and got rid of them about a year ago because I'd gotten out of reading.  NOW I just bought the Outlander book again, and read it, now I need the others...going to read the whole series again.  I love Claire and Jamie!

Generally I stay as far away from romance novels as possible, but when a friend insisted that I give this a try, I found myself hooked! I immediatly read the rest of the series and have been waiting for months (sometimes not as patiently as I would like) for the next intallment. The story is well told, the characters (especially some of the minor ones) are compelling, and it is very easy to become hooked. There is a reason why people have formed fan clubs and why there is a companion to the books. They are simply great!

I adored reading this book & am currently looking forward to the next book in this series!  I felt that the book started a bit slow (first few pages) but ended up regretting that thought when I got somewhere around page twenty or so. This is a book with depth and dimensions, I laughed (a lot!), I cried and there were times I isn't want to stop reading, I just wanted to fall inside of it. Anyways, great read & I think if given the shot, anyone could (and would) love this book & the characters. Props to Diana Gabaldon!

The book started out fantastic, but then about halfway through turned into a strange love story. At that point, the main character seems to go a bit mad and does some quite questionable things. It's been a long time since I've read a story where I just couldn't wait for it to be over. I won't be continuing with this series. I was looking for something with a bit more history and depth. This just became someone's romantic fantasy, with too much focus on a rape and some slightly bizarre, non-consensual BDSM thrown in.
Although the story line is interesting, the violet sex scenes weren't for me.
Interesting storyline but it is filled with too much romance/sex for my taste

Outlander was a novel my mother told me to read when it came out in 1992. For whatever reason i did not read it. I was infatuated with Scottish History and so it should have been a book I gobbled up, but I did not..then. But now? 16ish years later a writing group buddy told me to read it and so I did.... I loved it. The romance is there, but because this story is more character driven and the characters are not complete sops its not heavy on the sloppy description of characters like so many other romance novels.

I found this book incredibly boring. I had to fight to get halfway through it, luckily the ending got a little more interesting. I can't believe my eyes if there are people saying this is the best book they have ever read.  Just know that this a a simple romance book (Claire can't keep her hands of  Jamie and vice versa, they make love, they fight)with a little adventure  (for sure not enough). I don't understand why she needs 850 pages to tell  her story. Why didn't we hear from Frank, how does he feel? I wouldn't even  recommend it for light summer reading and for the same reason, I will not  read any of the sequels. THIS IS ONLY FOR ROMANCE READERS.

Outlander is quite possibly the greatest book I've ever encoutered. Her story is truly too enthralling for words, her characters are vivid and completely three-dimensional, and her writing style is simply beautiful. As  a debut novel, and written by a research professor, Outlander is nothing  less than a masterpiece. Jamie and Claire are wonderful! It's no wonder  that so many people are so obsessed with Gabaldon's books! Don't let the  size scare you!  In fact, once you've read this book, you will have to  read the others...over and over again. This is a story worth savoring.

I picked this book up years ago on a whim (I was on a historical fiction/time travel craze at the time) and was I pleasantly surprised. Ms. Gabaldon's historical research was meticulous, her dialogue believable, and her description of places was amazing. I loved this book so much I want to go to Scotland, where (believe it or not) they actually do give Outlander tours to go to all the places mentioned in her novels. After the way I trailblazed through all six of these, I say sign me up. Fantastic reading.

With this first book in the series, Gabaldon takes the reader to a different place and time...literally!  Her descriptive narratives and well researched material made my first foray into the genre of historical romance (although I hesitate to use that categorization) a wonderful one.  Although my house, laundry, etc. suffered, I revelled in the splendor of this novel.  Am I gushing?  You bet, and deservedly so.  I finished the first four books in a week and am looking forward to The Fiery Cross immensely.

Yawn... Halfway through I gave up (something I rarely do with a novel) and stopped reading. I really liked the main character and was intrigued at the beginning of the book. Liked the set up (what's going to happen?) and the author's writing style. But once she got to medieval Scotland, I found myself becoming less and less interested in the characters. It became a romance novel (as a friend said, "But one set in the Scotland Highlands!") Regardless of the setting, not enough to keep my interest.

First read this is the 90's - - have reread it at least 4 or times. Although I still have paper version (although after loaning to so many friends I had to buy a 2nd one!) I bought this on my kindle so I could reread prior to the Starz series beginning.  I think it's the best book of the series, because it's where it all started. Diana is such a talented writer that you always feel you're right there with her.  It's where we all first fall in love with Jaime and Claire.  And they've only just begun.....

Once in a while I'll pick up a book that I just can't put down despite my breakneck schedule with a husband and three small children.  This is certainly one of them.  Diana Gabaldon's extraordinary ability to transport the reader directly within the scene that is playing out is for me, much like going to an adult version of Disney World.  I love history and this is truly like being in 18th century Scotland.  Well done Diana and I can't wait to reccomend this and read the rest.  Keep em' comin' Lass!

I started watching the Starz's version of Outlander and fell in love with the story line and shows,  I can't wait until #9 of series l continues.  I will be going out now and buying all of Diana Gabaldon's books on the Outlander.  There are few movies or TV series that I have enjoyed, but this is a keeper for me.  I hope in the future we will be able to get a DVD on the whole series.  Thank you Diana Gabaldon for the books and for Starz for the TV showings {please keep them coming}.  Sincerely a FAN.

Which is fine if you like gothic romance...but I was disappointed after reading good reviews for this.  Lots of cliches, sex scenes that weren't worth the time it took to read them and a predictable story line made me ready to put this down after reading about 50 pages. I bought this one and the second based on the reviews. Amazon has a good return policy, so I am returning the second one, as I never even opened it. I was hoping for an involved time-travel fantasy and got light romance. Oh well...

This book is going into my top 10, stuck on a desert island collection.  I could not put it down.  This book includes romance, war, intrigue, mystery, suspense, villians, history... You will not be dissapointed.  I loved (and loved to hate) all of the characters.  Gabaldon puts you right there, living alongside of the story, watching it unfold in person.  I'm sure this will be a book series I will read over and over again, and will be the first I recommend to anyone who says "Know any good books?"

I recently purchased "Outlander" after having read it previously.  I bought two copies and gave one to a friend.  It is a swashbuckling adventure of epic scale.  Diana Gabaldon is a master at transporting her readers into a world of dashing heroes and heroines and diabolical villans. Added in is a mixture of greed, power, scorcery, romance, sex and time travel all set within an historical backdrop in Scotland. The "Outlander" series will keep the reader totally entertained and enthalled as well.

A wonderful journey through time with likeable characters and great storytelling. A few things I didn't like: too much bible verses and reading and discussions. I realize they were at a monesary but it was too much for my taste. The middle and end were very slow going. Some scenes went on forever! Can we just move on already! A few sentences to describe would have been fine, but the author chose to write page after page. Very unnecessary. Overall a good read and I would recommend to friends.
Don't know why I bought book, but it is not my style and couldn't finish.

I purchased this book on a whim.  I was suprised to find myself quickly becoming obsessed with the story and characters.  I just couldn't put it down and have read it twice while waiting for the sequels.  Diana's wonderful descriptions put me right there, like no other author ever has.  I knew barely anything about Scottish history.  Not only was I entertained, but found that I learned a great deal about this place and period in history.  I just love this book - it is more than a must read!

No words to explain how wonderful this book is!!  I could not put it down.  I fell in love with Claire and Jamie. The age differnce put a special tough on this love affair. I enjoyed the way thier love grew and became so strong. The way Gabaldon discriped each scene is wonderful, even the part when Jamie was imprisoned by Randell.  I would have to put it down, then be back in a few minutes to read more. Gabaldon has a great gift of words. I'm going out today to buy Dragonfly in Amber.
Absolutely wonderful, a book you could read 10 times and still not lose interest

As a rule, I don't enjoy re-reading a book. However, I can't wait to re-read this book. Claire, Jamie and the rest are some of the most compelling characters I have ever found in a romance novel. This is a huge book, but I tore through it in two days and moved right on to the sequel. Unfortunately, I have read far enough in the series to know that the quality of storytelling drops off significantly, but I will read the original again to help rekindle the Claire/Jamie romance.

I actually purchased this as a gift for my brother, who loved it as much as I did, which actually surprised me a bit, but confirms that it's not just a "chick" book.  I've been reading this series since DG came out with the first one (Outlander) probably 20+ years ago and have been waiting breathlessly for the latest one to come out (Written In My Own Hearts Blood).  My one and only complaint is the length of time between each book, but they are well worth the wait.

I've literally had this book for 3 years, I was intimidated by the length of the book, but I finally told myself after reading all the reviews I have to read it.  Although the book is written very well, I must say it wasn't as good as the reviews say.  I feel the story could have been written in half the amount of pages that it was.  Some of the reviews say it is the best romance story ever, well, I can tell you I have read better.  The ending was kind of unbelievable too.

For all the negative remarks out there all I am going to say is, read on.  All of the things you claim are lacking in this book are remedied in the following novels.  The characters are developed in great depth as the series progresses.  Also, the "lust" aspect is cooled down quite a bit as well.  The more I read, the more I fell in love with Diana Gabaldon as an author.  These novels blow all other "romance" novels out of the water.  Excellent series, exceptional writing.

It starts in the 1940's, and the heroine time-travels to the 1740's and becomes involved in the lives of Scottish Highlanders, experiencing love, clan warfare, persecution and near-death.  It is a good read, and contains a great many details about ancient ways, but is not for the faint of heart.  My friends who recommended it didn't tell me it was an erotic romance--that aspect of it got a bit tiresome.  I enjoyed this book, but don't think I will be reading the sequels.

Never in all my years of reading has 2 characters had me so emotionally involved in a book. The author has given us a vivid view of what true love can be and she did it beautifully. While I am sure not all of her history facts are absolutely true, she has given us the beginning of a series that captures your heart and emotions. One of the best books I have ever read and I am on the third book so with that said, I applaud her for creating such beauty in so many words.

This book is stunning!! Diana Gabaldon is an amazing story-teller. The characters and story completly take you to another time... its like you become apart of the story, like you know the character personally!! Its just amazing, the WHOLE SERIES is amazing. A DEFINITE MUST READ for fans of history, fiction, and romance books. I just can't say enough about it, I'll re-read the series over and over.. These books have set the bar for my future readings, and I don't think anything will match up! READ IT!! YOU'LL LOVE IT!!

I read this book after hearing about it being turned into a show on Starz.  I figured it must be good if they were making it into a show.  Well, it is an enjoyable read, if a little predictable.  I guess the best way for me to describe it is teenage lit, slightly more sexy , and a lot more gory/sadistic.  I would classify this as  junk food literature.  A bit cravable, but after a while, you get tired of it and want something with real substance.  At least, I did.

diana is the most awesome author i have ever read!  i compare all others to her and find them sooo lacking!  just hope i live long enough to read the finish story of jamie and clair.  they have become important to me, and as we talk about them, almost real.  sure would love to see a tv series of her books.  if i see the finish of this series, sure hope diana continues with stories of bree, roger, jem and mandy.  5 stars are no where near a good ehough rating!!

I found a battered and well used copy of this book on the wrong shelf in my school library and started to read it. I decided to use it for a paper/project. I fell in love with the story and was very pleased to find there were more books in the series. One by one I devoured them eagerly. Through the years I have read and re-read every book to date in the series. It is almost like the characters are family. Diana Gabaldon has an incredible gift for story telling.

This is in my top ten best books list. I read this book years ago and wanted it on my Kindle. I re-read it this year. While I knew the basic story, there is so much detail that I had forgotten. It was like reading it for the first time again. I can't say enough about the great writing and well-developed characters in this series. I purchased the paperback version for my 90-year-old aunt who loves to read. You can't stop with Outlander, you must read them all.

The Outlander is an exciting and wonderfully woven story of the romance between Claire and Jamie, and includes a fairly accurate portrayal of long-ago politics in Scotland, with a twist of science fiction thrown in.  The intracasy with which Diana Gabaldon writes about the characters and locations of the story make the reader feel right there alongside the characters. It is a commitment to reading the entire series of long books, but well worth your time!

This is one of the best books I have ever read!  I say one of the best because I have read the entire series about Jamie and Claire Fraser and they are all excellent!  Diana Gabaldon is now my favorite author ( and I read a lot of books).  I look forward to the next installment in this series and hope she writes it soon!  If you haven't read this series, I highly recommend that you do.  Once you read Outlander, there is no stopping or going back!  Enjoy!

Diana Gabaldon takes what could be just another sappy romance novel and infuses it with great writing, accurate research and lots of fun. The characters are all so real and vibrant that I feel as if I actually know them. This rich characterization goes beyond just the two main characters -- Clare and Jamie. So many of the other people in the book come alive and make you want to know them more. I highly recommend this book to everyone I know. Almost all of them have become Outlander addicts as well.

I love historical fiction, and this book was recommended by a friend.  It is well-written and often engaging, but there are far too many erotic interludes that read like rape fantasies for my taste.  I don't know how many shades of grey this story qualifies for, but it's a few shades more than I want to deal with.  If you are female (or a gay man, possibly), and like the idea of being sexually dominated/brutalized, you might enjoy it more than I did.

I thought this book was going to be fairly predictable...boy was I wrong!  I thought this was going to be a rather dark and sinister book, one I wouldn't like at all...boy was I wrong!  I have not seen the show and after reading the book I am certain I don't want to see it.  This book played like a movie in my head and I'm certain any television or movie series could not do any better!  I loved the book!  I thank all my friends who suggested it to.

I always enjoy a good read, but rarely do I fall in love with characters. I absolutely love this book! I can't put this series down and am already looking forward to beginning the series over again, to savor the books at my leisure, as I am so desperate to find out what happens next....am sure I am missing much this read through. I find myself exclaiming out loud at the story, and immersing myself completely in the story between Jamie and Claire.
Not my cup of tea.  Too much time spent on what I consider trivia.

Had a hard time putting it down.  It was long, and the four star rating is due to its dragging occasionally.  That said, I enjoyed it, and I am not a big fan of scifi - as in time travel.  But the characters are well defined, the dialect easy to understand, the scenes vivid, and the ending leaving me hungry for more.  Couldn't get the second of the series on Kindle, but our local library had it, and I am well into the next series of adventures.

I'm not a "romance" reader, but this particular series gripped me from the very beginning.  The Scottish background, history, rich characters, and the hint of science fiction/fantasy....the series has everything.  I read through all four books so fast and I've been waiting patiently for the next one to be published!  Now I'm ready to begin re-reading the entire series from the first page!  Diana - please get the next book out soon!

This is the first book of this type I've ever read. My girlfriend recommended it to me and I read it in 3 days. It's an outstanding book. This book is sure a page turner that not only grabs your attention, but stays with you long after finishing the book. I've started the second book in the series and so far it's as fantastic as the first. The story line is outstanding along with the details of history. I give this book a solid 10!

This book has everything - romance, history, wit, humor, drama, love, you name it.  You will be completely transported into Gabaldon's world - believe me, you won't want to leave it.  At first you may be put off by knowing that this is the first in a series of 7 REALLY BIG BOOKS.  Then you will be incredibly thankful that the story keeps going and you can lose yourself again and again.  I can't recommend this book strongly enough.

Diana Gabaldon's books go so far beyond "Historical Romance"  that they should be in a category all their own.  The Outlander series has  it all- history, love, sex, evil, magic, war...  But be warned:  this book  will make you fall in love, make you laugh, make you hate, and then it will  break your heart like no other book can do.  Once you pick up this book,  James Fraser will haunt your thoughts and dreams forever.

An intriguing story that kept me entertained throughout. The Scottish dialog made it really come to life as the setting in the past.  On the edge of my seat waiting for the outcome of this modern-day time traveler who adapts well to her surroundings. Lots of emotion and courage shown by the characters. Graphic in description but not vulgar. I am reading the second in this series now.  I recommend it to fans of historical novels.

Ok, this book and all the other 3 that follows were the best read I've had  in a while.  I thought it was a typical romance but it wasn't.  It was  Adventure, Historical, Sci-Fi, Romance, and god only knows what else.  Diana Gabaldon is incredible and she writes w/ such descriptive words,  phrases, and everything else on the list.  I couldn't put the books down.  I read all 4+Outlandish within 2 months and now I can't wait for the 5th  book.......Hurry up Diana!!!!

I really enjoyed this book and the struggle of Claire and her two worlds.  It is a book that takes its time but I enjoyed getting to know the characters and the surroundings.  I will say that there is a part towards the end of the book that was too graphic for me, in a bad way.  I did have to skim over it.  Some human hardships are too much for me to try and even wiggle my toe into, but I always love to see things redeemed.

Though Diana didn't really snag me in until the fourth chapter the first time I read this novel, I became a Diana Gabaldon fan for life by the end. These novels are no short read, that's for sure. But they are worth all the time and effort needed to complete the series so far (ABOSAA). All I tell my friends when starting Outlander is to prepare for a long, magical, and emotional journey like none they've ever taken before.

I cannot imagine any book better than this.  I have just re-read Outlander as it has been a long time since my original reading and I loved it even more this time.  It may be deemed to be a woman's book because it is a wonderful love story, however it also has elements that would appeal to a male reader. I can barely wait for the series that STARZ has now in production.  The other 6 books in the series are also wonderful.

I read this book a couple of years ago when a friend let me borrow it.  I read the whole series within about six months, and now I decided it's time to start all over again!  I am enjoying it just as much the second time around.  A magnificent love story, along with mystery, action, history, suspense, tragedy, joy, you name it.  I've never read anything that mesmerized me so, and I can't wait til D.G. writes another one.

I won't go into the story plot...by now we all know what this book is about. What I will say is that it is a breathtaking, powerful look at men, women, family, honor, marriage, love. What strikes me is that Claire and Jamie's loyalty to each other is so essential not only for their very survival, but for their very souls lives'as well. By the end Jamie is more human than he will ever be, and you will be out of breath!

My favorite historical fiction novel of the last year or two is The Triumph and the Glory, but Diana Gabaldon's time travel epic OUTLANDER is a close second.  The appeal of this genre is the transportation of the reader  to other times and places with style and compelling realism, and Gabaldon  accomplishes this task very well indeed.  Great reading, well-developed  characters, a good balance of suspense and romance.

I am thoroughly hooked on this story.  Just when I would think it was about to end, another adventure would begin, and I would be continually surprised.  The characters are marvelous, I can see how easily it lends itself to a visual medium like the screen.  By the way, the chapter about the Perpetual Adoration hour was spot on!  God thank the author for that!  I'm off to the next book as fast as I can download it!

I read a lot.  I would rather read than do almost anything else.  I read all genres.  This is the ONLY book that I have finished and then immediately (without even getting off the sofa) gone back to the beginning to start it again.  It is THAT good.  The way this author puts words together is nothing less than delightful.  The characters are fully developed, interesting and some are appealing beyond explanation!

outlander was given to me by a friend who said that i should read it on the plane. i do not read romance books but she told me it was worth it. i picked it up feeling a little lost in a new land. it only took three days  to finish it. i then passed it to a friend. we talk about the book when we  see each other. i am curently waiting the arrival of the sequal.  this book  has been passed all around. it was great.

Firstly, its just a romance novel with the gimmick of time travel thrown in to try and appeal to a wider audience. If you do not want to read a romance novel, stop right now. I forced myself to finish it, but it really wasn't good for me. Almost all aspects of the plot and characters seemed very contrived to me. Its more or less a way for the main character to cheat on her husband because "time travel".

Hello I am someone who won't read unless it is good and I could not put this book down!  Not only is it romantic and wonderful the characters are to die for and I never wanted it to end!  I am scared to read another book because I am worried that it won't be as good.  Trust me this is a must read and I have never loved any book more than I love this one!  My all time favorit.  And I mean that with all my heart!

It is readable, but definitely not for me.  I found the story very slow moving, with not very likeable characters.  The main character is supposed to be intelligent and independent, but she shows very little in the way of ever thinking things through before acting, and is always surprised by the negative results this  results in.  All in all, I am stuck bout halfway through, and not likely to take it up again.

I wrestled through about a third of the book thinking it would get better, but finally gave up.  I can only review what I read. It has an interesting premise, however, description followed by description followed by description, with little of interest to keep you turning the page, was very disappointing.  Hopefully it gets better later in the book. I just couldn't make myself stick with it long enough to see.

Not bad, not great.  More like a well written bodice ripper.  The time travel was a nice twist, She seemed to do her research well, with one glaring mistake.  She describes the recoil from a pistol of the period as being excessive.  Not true...I have fired such weapons for the past 40 years, and the recoil from  a replica flintlock pistol, using authentic loads is less than that of a modern .45 cal handgun.  .

Outlander is my favorite book EVER! I couldn't put it down, & then I had to read the entire series!! It is a great story of love & adventure and what makes life worth living. D.G. has an amazing way of turning a phrase that makes you feel like you are there & these people are real. I have recommended Outlander to 3 friends & they have all gone on to read the whole series as well. Try it - you will LOVE it!!!!
Felt slow in a lot of places...too much descriptive I guess.

This book was recommended to me by women, I like and admire.  I read a lot of it, did not like it but persevered to see what I was missing. This is not historical fiction.  It is a romance novel, lots of soft porn and violence, contrived to fit a period in the history of Scotland - and it is very contrived.  If you want the sexy romance stuff alone, this may be for you.  But if you want good historical fiction, run away before you pick up this book.  Cannot imagine that this is a series, I couldn't make it through the first book.

I'm not normally into science fiction but I love historical fiction so I picked this book up not expecting much.  I soon fell in love with the characters and couldn't put it down.  This is by far one of the best books I've read (and I read a lot!!).  I can't believe this is Gabaldon's first book.  She writes like a master and her storytelling is unparalleled.  READ THIS BOOK...you will not be disappointed.

I had not really read a romance novel since I was a teenager but a co-worker recommended it to me so I thought I would give it a try.  I am hooked.  I am in the middle of the fourth book and have trouble putting it down.  Two of my co-workers have also started reading it on my recommendation and they have already passed me in the series.  I am eager to finish the series and will be sad when it finally ends.

Absolutely fascinating...I read this book (almost 900 pages) in four days - and it took me that long because I had to feed my family!!  I devoured this book and wanted more!!  I can't recommend it highly enough.  I just adored Jaime but I did think that Clair's character could have had a little more personality than just bossing Jaime around when he was wounded.  Be that as it may, still one helluva book.

This is what I refer to as a "beach book."  Take it to the lake or country and don't stop till you're done.  The writing is graphically violent and sexual but, in between the blood and lust, there are vivid images of wood and heather, and castle halls lighted with torches.  In spite of myself, I wanted more of the brave, adventurous and somehow innocent James Fraser.  Gabaldon spins a good yarn.

I am so happy to have finally jumped on the Outlander bandwagon. Two decades after it's release, I began the epic tale and was at once totally immersed in Claire and Jamie's adventure. This story has everything: time-travel, Scottish highland warriors (in kilts, mind you), constant danger interspersed with humor and the most romantic dialogue I have ever read. My only regret was turning the last page.

Perhaps if I'd not read all the hype I wouldn't be giving it only 3 but maybe 4 stars, I don't know.  To me, it just didn't live up to what so many reviewers said.  It was definitely long, so if you're looking for something to do with several nights it's good for that.  I also think the story "went places" that it didn't need to go, and if/when you read it you'll know what I'm referring to.

I'm all in favor of a lengthy book.  Especially if its well written or has interesting content.  This book had neither in my opinion.  After all the glowing reviews, I really looked forward to reading it.  But this book (and the plot) dragged on and on.  The concept was interesting, but the execution wasn't there.  Admittedly after reading ~40% of the book (equates to about 350 printed pages), I pulled the plug and deleted it from my Kindle (something I never do).  Usually the Amazon book reviews are spot on- I've relied on them to pick numerous winners.  I'm really puzzled about this one though....

Love, love, love this story...Jamie is "the man"!  Started watching the TV series first, then had to read the books; the personification of Jamie could not have been portrayed any better than it has by Sam [Heughan].  Thank you, Diana Gabaldon, for writing this wonderful book series and thank you Ronald Moore, for bringing this story to visual life for me and all Jamie and Claire's fans!

When I first started reading this, book I didn't think I'd like the time travel concept, but started to read it anyway for our book club pick.  After Claire passed through the circle of stones, I couldn't put the book down!  When Jamie was introduced, I fell in love with him and hoped the Claire would too.  The story was action packed and had me on the edge of my seat several times.  Great book!

I loved the premise of this book. I wasn't expecting the love story that ensued, however, I did love the characters. At first glance, I thought of Octavia Butler's Kindred, but as it turned out it was nothing like Kindred except for the throw back in time. The author's effort to descript the scene's was a little distracting; as less is better. Overall I did like the book and would recommend it.

This is one of the most amazing books I've ever read...And I think Diana Gabaldon did such a great job! It is a very unusual story, full of romance, adventure, history, plus great sense of humor! I started reading this book and I couldn't put it down. I really liked Claire and I absolutely fell in love with Jamie...You must read this book, this will probably be my second favorite love story so far, and my first is Jane Eyre...

Overall, I think that Gabaldon's book is a grand spectacles of life in that era.  However, the graphic scenes of torture were unnecessary and revolting.  I think it's highly unlikely that anyone, even strong Jamie, could survive toture sessions like the ones he endured.  Those scenes turned my stomach and made me turn the pages faster to skip over it.  A disappointing end to a marvelous tale.

Probably the best love story ever written!!!!!!!!! Gabaldon is a genius! Yes the book is violent and the premise seems unplausible, but it is amazingly well done. The characters are so full of life and dimension. They come to life in your head, and you can almost hear them speaking, with the lovely Scottish expressions and dialect. Great, great book! The rest of the series is as captivating!

I love this book!  and I bought the audio verison to be able to listen to the story, but they cut out the heart of it for the abridgement. If you have read the book and wondered "How DO you pronounce Sassenach or  Laoghaire," buy the audio version.  It is worth the price.  If you  have not read the book, don't bother.  Please, to those in the position to  make the call of whether or not to abridge a book : DO NOT!

I happened upon the televised series almost accidentally. WOW. The exactly correct blend of mysticism, romance and historical drama and how well the strange "past" is compared and finally accepted by Claire. My daughter bought me the first book, Outlander--over 800 pages and as I read it, I see the characters on t.v. They were well cast. I cannot wait for the next season to begin.
Good book but too much time spent on creating love scenes

Outlander was given to me as a birthday present years ago. As a "little taste of Scotland."  I take it with me when traveling in case I want to have an interesting (re)read.  I have since purchased all of the Diana Gabaldon series and look forward to her Book # 8.  I love the series so much that I purchased it to give as a gift to a new spiritual friend.  She loves the book also!

This book totally captured me!  I never in a million years thought I would read something like this, but several people said they loved it and I got curious and decided to check it out.  Once I started reading it, I couldn't put it down.  I have read the whole series and I was so sad to finish the last one.  If you like  historical fiction, I would definitely say, take time to read this!

I have never cried while reading a book, till now. While thrown into this story of love, heartbreak and romance I truly felt the characters of "Outlander" and their feelings for the first time as a reader. Only an amazing author can pull these emotions from her readers, and Diana Gabaldon does. When I finished "Outlander" I rushed to Amazon and order the next books in the series for overnight delivery. I'm addicted.

Although a current television hit, the book moves at a snails pace.  The author does a great job of going in extreme depth of detail on occasion, and  I found myself skimming through conversations.  Although it's a good and powerful story, I did find myself thinking "Get on with it" or "I'll just go watch the series"... but I am glad I stuck with it and read the book!

This is a replacement book for my worn out original Outlander!  This series, by the outstanding Diana Gabaldon, is so well written with the characters of these books becoming your friends....people you just can't live without.  I have read the series many times over book to book and even gone back to read my most favorite parts numerous times.  You must read these books...you must!

If you are lucky enough to catch this book for free with Kindle, then you should jump all over it! This is one of the best books I have ever read. The characters will stay with you and it is a story that you can't look away from. It will haunt you and make you crave more. Lucky Gabaldon has a huge series with this book and you can get a good fill of Jamie and Clair. Just wonderful.

I love all the Outlander books. Diana Gabaldon has a true gift with words, and one ca loose ones self in her world. As improbabe as the storyline is, it all feels so real. The adventure, the romance, (one that many women wish they had), the people within the storyline are described superbly. Over the years I have waited for each book to come out, and I have not been disappointed.

I don't usually read romances but I decided to give this a try since it was free.  Big mistake!  I'm on the fourth book in the series and I've already purchased the rest.  I love this author.  I don't know what else she has written but I can't wait to find out.  The fourth book is my favorite so far and Claire's comments on the ferocious sow farrowing in the pantry are hilarious.

A co-worker turned me on to this series.  I love a good docudrama and this series of books certainly fills that requirement.  Lots of Scottish history from the 1700's and a unique twist from the 1940's on with the time travel angle. You'll love the characters and Gabaldon does an extraordinary job of storytelling. You'll feel as though you're right there with Claire and Jamie.

This book (and series) is OUTSTANDING. This story is such an emotional rollercoaster ride, you are so connected to Claire and Jaime that your heart actually hurts at times.  Their love is so strong that it stands the test of time, literally! So exited this has hit the big screen and I hope it's as good as the books.  Thanks Diana for this story of Claire and Jaime!  I love it!

The history and jargon was fascinating but there the plot was a bunch of events tied together with violence and sex. I won't be reading anymore of the series. I enjoy historical fiction and it can have wonderful dignity while still portraying the times. Was this a violent time in history, yes, but does it need to be so graphic to get the same point across, not in my opinion.

This book can be summed up with one sentence: His only crime was he loved too much-in Scotland! A bodice ripper that passes itself off for sci fi and historical fiction and isn't a good example of any of the three. Much female fantasy domination sex in this book that wasn't for my taste. Jamie is also too perfect to be a real man. As cardboard of a character as you can have.

This book is not like your regular mushy romance.  Claire Randall is a distinctively powerful character who is a real woman and not a stuffy, snobby, ignorant woman like in other books.  You will laugh, cry, and be  astonished at the sensuality that is witheld in this text. You will fall in  love with Jamie and the passion that he shows for Claire.  A sensual  masterpiece!

This is not a bad book. The characters have magnificent descriptions, and you come to know them well, but it is just so long. I am a fast reader, but even so, this novel dragged on and on. I read it--I didn't just stop reading it so I did want to know what happened to the characters. But, I'm just warning you, unless you enjoy a LONG read, you may want to skip this one.

Every day I looked forward to finding time to read more of Jamie and Claire. Outlander is a lovely story set in the beautiful lands of Scotland. A wonderful romance, without being so steamy that I'd skip scenes. I'm looking excitedly toward reading the next novel in the series. Wish that I could watch the series on Starz. Hopefully it will be available on Netflix soon.

I am absolutely torn by the fact that it's a bit of a page turner and it is ridiculous to have a feisty 21st century heroine think it was ok to be beaten by her husband. The homosexual sadism was so suggestively prurient it made Shades of Grey look like candy floss. I think it is a shame the writer's talent for humor and pace and sexual tension couldn't be edited into something more finely tuned.

This book is great ... if you enjoying reading about male rape.  And what red blooded heterosexual female doesn't?  Am I right ladies?  The man of your dreams being savaged by another man.  Ah good times.  I am hoping Ms Gabaldon can do a re write of Braveheart and include a scene where William Wallace is captured by the English and the King's son has his way wi im.

It's hard to believe this is Diana Gabaldon's first novel. The writing style draws you in and you forget you are reading until you have to turn the page. Like listening to juicy, satisfying gossip. Not at all your typical romance novel, even makes a red-headed hero believable and sexy. Be careful who you loan this book to, mine have gone "missing" more than once.

This book was an interesting exercise in 'what would happen if a woman went back in time.'  I like romance novels and science fiction/fantasy novels, however I couldn't really get into this series. I didn't find the main character likable and I couldn't get into book 2 because the author seemed to move the plot along through the main character's stupidity.

At the enthusiastic recommendation of a reading friend, I started reading Outlander. I've read the first 150 pages because I wanted to give it a chance even though I was annoyed after the first few pages. The old-fashioned word "vulgar" comes to mind to describe this book. It is kitsch, overdone, and tawdry. No accounting for taste is all I can say to the reviewers rating this book with five stars.

With all the hype about the TV series based on the "beloved" books, I expected to be entranced by Outlander but wasn't as much as I  hoped. I found the novel longer than necessary and meandering at times. I usually enjoy this genre of novel and there were parts I did but overall I didn't enjoy it enough to want to read the next one in the series.

This is an interesting concept, and I applaud the author for her character development and consistent plot lines. She is an excellent writer. However, I found the book gratuitously violent. The author seems obsessed with women and children, in particular, being beaten and tormented, and men being whipped and maimed. I didn't finish it for that reason.

This is truly the best book I have ever read. I've read it 4 times and it never gets old. You feel as if the characters are real people, and that you are experiencing everything they are. Diana Gabaldon is the best author, hands down! I've read the entire series, and go back to Outlander over and over. These characters will become a part of your life!

Ugh! This silly story is just plain badly written.  It's chock full of romance novel cliches, repetitive scenes, one-dimensional cardboard characters, ludicrous situations, pointless violence, boring sex, and not a drop of sensuality or soul to be found on any page.  It's one big yawn.  As a rule I avoid all things Scotland or time travel, but this book has such a devoted following, I decided to try it.  I'll be skipping the sequels; I cannot imagine putting myself through the agony.

While the book was historically fascinating, a great tale of love, and a good length, I have to say I was surprised by the role rape played in the story. I understand character development and the need for an antagonist, but I found myself uncomfortable during the last half of the story. Good book, but I can't say I will continue reading the series.

AMAZING! Diana Gabaldon has perfectly mixed history, suspense, mystery and timeless love. She is now one of my favorite authors. I was brought to tears in all 3 books of the Outlander series that I've completed. I just bought the fourth. I will be purchasing ALL of the series, and checking out her other novels as well. BRAVO! 5 STARS aren't enough!
Good story but needed a savage edit in some places to speed up the action. Overall it's an enjoyable read if you skim over the  boring bits.
I'm so glad this is a series!!!  I stumbled across this book by chance and I'm so glad I did. It's a great read & it has you hooked after just a few chapters.  A must read

This was a 6 star read. It's a book written a couple if decades ago but no less current in this world of mass literature. I spend a lot of time in Scotland, so I gelled with the setting easily because the feel of the land was so well portrayed. To describe what this book is about briefly is quite a challenge, a historical romance with a sci if feel? As time travelling, historical romance? Claire lives in post WW2 re establishing her relationship with her husband after a long war separation. They travel to Scotland for an extended holiday and explore a stone circle. Claire returns alone and finds herself plunged 200 years in the past through some power the stones seem to hold. She is picked up by a band of highlanders and as an ex-nurse finds herself having to tend to Jamie, a clansman. Jamie and Claire are characters I really grew to like. They are not sickly sweet and as you can imagine, Claire's modern ways, cursing, feminism and language do not make life easy. This book had true depth and I enjoyed this in a way that I can't quite put words to. I may be late to the party, but Diana Gabaldon has a new fan!
Engaging characters, sweeping history, exquisite prose. I enjoyed every page of this historical romance. The suspense and adventure held me through the end.

If you are stressed beyond belief, you need this book.  It provides an instant mental vacation, engulfing you in what we call the Calgon-take-me-away.  The characters are complex, the descriptions rich, and the history captivating.  I've read the other 6 books in this series 3 or 4 times and purchased them again on Audible.com.  I am a reader and have never been so over-the-moon over any other series.......ever.
Entertaining and educational. The little sciemce fiction aspect in a historical novel puts the reader in the role of a witness.

If you are a fan of time-travel/romance (as I am!) then there is no better story than this.  Beautifully written, and evocative of a bygone era, this book grabs you from the first and doesn't let go... I cannot recommend this highly enough!
Epic love story, murder, violence, humour, history! When I put this book down, I'm afraid I'm missing what's going on in the story!
The whole series leaves you spell-bound. You actually feel like you are there. I would recommend this book to anyone!
It is impossible to put this book down once you get into it.  It took me almost 200 pages to really get into it but it is sooooo worth it.
I am a Diana Gabaldon addict. This is the 10th time I have read this book and I will continue with the other 6 volumes...again!

Loved this book really exciting, kept me guessing as to the characters and events. Type of book you can not put down and now can't wait to read the next book in the series. Loved the main characters and the historical significance was interesting. This book is quite long but I liked that as I did not want it to end.

This book was recommended to me by a friend. Something that I would not normally read. It was amazing. An emotional roller coaster ride. The main characters, Jamie and Clare, were brilliant. The chemistry that Diana Gabaldon had created with them was fantastic. By the end of the book I felt like I had known them forever. The storyline was great. Just when you thought the plot was going along nicely there would be another twist to the story. I have read all the books in the series, so far, and this is the best. I even read it again after I had finished the last book and found a different understanding in some parts. I have recommended this book to all my friends.

This was my first e-book. I wanted something special for my transition from book to e-book, and I loved the story and the kindle experience. Great read, great author - well written. Wish I could write like this, just makes you want to go there.

This story is packed with excitement, romance, history and just spellbinding adventure.  I found it fascinating to see how the main character Claire would cope with the day to day travails, using her knowledge of medicine and modern living, circa 1945, in the time into which she was transported.  A wonderful book, I didn't want it to end.  A. Deef

The story is well written and very intriguing.  I didn't care for the degree to which the author included the love story though.  I don't care for romance stories and I found myself skipping over some of the long scenes involving Jamie and Claire's love making.  Definitely more saga or even romance than historical fiction, but an enjoyable story.

I was skeptical at first when I heard this was a historical romance. But just two chapters in, I was hooked. There is a lot of description and verbage but it never stalled. I could hardly put it down despite the long descriptions of battles, life in 18th century Scotland, etc. It was a refreshing book in a sea of such drivel being written today.

Really slow.  I never really got into the book or even wanted to read it.  I had heard such good things, but the real kicker was the fact that no one ever calls shenanigans on the lead.  She clearly does not fit in and should have been judged much more harshly from the beginning.  It was barely even addressed that she was from a completely different time and place!

This story of love, and the historical interweaving of the Scottish clans conflict with the British compels you to read on!  The story creates an unquenchable desire to keep reading and to explore the next events!  A wonderful read!  I can hard,y wait to begin the next episode in the series!  A must read for those who love historical romance!

I mostly liked this book- until the end... it should come with a warning label on it that says "Graphic Man Rape" in large letters. Don't want to give anything away, but if you are disturbed by reading about very graphic and prolonged man rape (aka a man raping another man), this book is not for you (and its tough to skim it because I tried).

Too much romance novel for my taste.  The story was good, I bought the book because I enjoyed the TV series, but she spends way too much time on their physical relations and descriptions of the men's bodies.  I probably won't read the next one, altho I bought it.  I think she should have just stuck to the time travel story, which is great!
Needs more story line and less sexual situations.

This was a fun book to read, even the bits of Scottish history added to the drama and adventure.  However, the sex/love scenes seem to go on as if this was a cheap 'harlequin romance' kind of book.  Enough with the smut, there's other places for that!  Stick to the characters, the dialogue, and the story, their good enough on their own!

What can I say about this series of books? Outlander is the first in the series and may be my fav., its hard to say they are all so good, I have bought all of them and read them over and over. I never get bored with them! The storyline is interesting and the characters really live in your imagination, I can't recommend it highly enough!

If you like historical fiction, you will love this book.  It starts out a little slow, with a lot of detail, but begins to make sense as the chapters go by and by the end, you are wanting to read the next in the series!  There is a TV show now based on this book if you want the abridged version but I would recommend the book-as always!

This book is very good.  The beginning was a little dry but important once Claire goes back in time.  One part was extremely difficult to read because you feel like you know the character and you care for them.  I know there are some contraversial reviews but the book is well worth the read.  Not your typical fluffy romance which is very nice for a change.

Best series ever! I have loved these books since the 90's. I just read them over and over. I always discover something new each time I read them. Diana Gabaldon takes u to new lands and introduces u to rich characters. The page comes to life and transports me to another place and time.  Jaime and Claire are easy to fall in love with.

This is the 3rd time I read Outlander.  I wanted to read it while I watched Outlander on Starz. I have been to the Highlands of Scotland.  My mother was from Rosewell, a village outside Edinburgh. Her maiden name was MacKenzie.  I feel like all the people in Outlander were my relatives!  It was still a great book the 3rd time around!

Okay but not as good as it was cracked up to be. I found it kind of boring at times and it didn't entice me to read the next book. I wanted more mystery and magic. I also found the confluence of romance novel and sexual violence to be too much. Others have said that made the book realistic but to me it felt forced and too pervasive.

I received the book in a very timely manner. A while back, I had to repack all of my books that I had stored in a storage unit and some of them got damaged. I had to replace this book and I was so happy that I could find it on Amazon. I always recommend this site to all my friends when they are looking for a certain item. Thank you.

I read the entire first book and an now reading the second book. Book two is a bit confusing and I am trying to piece it all together. I am only continuing because I started -- if I had not started the series I would not have read this book, but if came highly recommended. The author drones on and uses a lot of outdated vocabulary.

I'm grateful to my best friend who insisted I had to read Outlander. I'm only sorry I waited so long!  What an amazingly delicious story with rich & satisfying characters that I was loathe to leave at the end of the book.  Thankfully, there are several more books in the series for me to devour & that's exactly what I'm going to do!

I'm in love with the characters in this book.  I can't get enough!  Jamie and Claire are so real.  This is by far one of the best books that I have ever read.  Needless to say, I've also read the three that followed it.  Everyone that I have shared these books with have agreed that there are no  others that can compare.  I can't wait for the 5th one!

I had been told it didn't really "belong" in the Romance section of the bookstore, but, after reading it, I think it is well placed.  If the premise sounded interesting to you but rape and frequent beatings (sometimes as foreplay) are not your cup of tea, I would highly recommend Connie Willis' Doomsday Book.  Time travel without the trash!

Initially, I saw a review on "Dragonfly in Amber" and was intrigued by the plot, so I decided to start the series in the beginning. What a fascinating and captivating book "Outlander" turned out to be.  Claire and Jamie are both incredibly strong and strong willed characters and their love story is beautiful.

I loved this book! I can't believe It took me this long to discover this series! It has the perfect blend of action and romance. It is intelligently written.  The language is beautiful. You will fall in love with the characters.  I am hooked and couldn't wait to start the next book in the series as soon as I finished this one.

I was just looking for a book in a bookstore once and came across Diana Gabaldon.  I decided to give her a chance.  I couldn't believe what I was reading.  It was a captivating book.  I couldn't put the book down.  I had to have the sequels right after I finished it.  Even though it was fantasy, it was believable. A great book

Wow!  A real page-turner it is, and a whalloping good tale, incorporating a fascinating bit of time travel, the inevitable clash between modern and 18th century cultures, frightening menaces and obstacles ... all wrapped up in a romance of epic proportion set against a fascinating yet heart-breaking era in Scotland's history.

James Malcolm McKenzie Fraser is hands down the best hero I've ever met.  I bought Outlander (hardback) over 20 years ago and can remember the lives of everyone in this series like they were family.  I bought the e-book to keep them close.  Ms. Gabaldon is a master storyteller and I am grateful she decided to be a writer.

Loved this book. I couldn't put it down once I got into it. Moved straight into the next book in the series once I was finished. I did get a little impatient at the beginning during the part of the story in the 1940's, as I wanted to skip to where she goes back to the 1740's, but it needed to be setup, I'm just impatient!

I started watching the series on Starz and could not wait for each week's episode, so finally oreder the book for my ipad. I cannot put it down and read it in record time.  Love the books, love the TV series as it does closely follow the books.  I find myself up way past bedtime reading to see what is next.  LOVED IT!!!

Outlander is a womans'  haliquen romance drug out beyond all human in durance. If it was a third as long it would have been far better. It gets exhausting waiting for something to develope.there is definitly a place for women's romance novels and I don't mean to disparage that but this one is just drug out way to long.

The new program on Starz has prompted me to purchase the Outlander books ( by : Diana Gabaldon ) I am hoping to collect all of the 8 books .  The series on Starz does follow the books closely , I just can't see myself waiting a entire year to find out what happens next.  I am 1/2 way thru the first book and I LOVE IT !

My sister recommended this series to me and I had a hard time getting into it and put it down. How foolish I was not to read in a bit more ... Thank goodness I have it another try. Its history, romance, drama, intrigue and a little witchcraft ... What's not to love? Hooked and will enjoy every last word in the series.

I love out-of-time sci-fi, but this one just didn't cut it for me.  I was absolutely unconvinced by the storyline, and didn't care if the main character got together with that Scottish guy or not.  I did not even finish reading the book. Wish I had gotten it at the library instead of buying it for my Kindle. Oh, well.

I fly a lot so taking a book is a must.  That is usually the only time I can really sit and read without distraction.  I loved this book, I couldn't put it down even when I got off the plane!  I read the entire series, I can't say they all were as good but as a whole the series was wonderful.  I highly recommend it!

I was introduced to Diana Gabaldon by my book club.  I am THOROUGHLY enjoying her writing style and the subject of  Outlander.  Her intimate descriptions of conversations between the characters makes you feel like they are sitting right in front of you, having their conversations.  I am VERY glad I bought the book.

I really really really didn't want to like this book, but I did.  It is pretty graphic, but speaks of the time and really of what kind of corruption and nastiness still happens in some areas today.  The romance story in it is swoon-worthy.  Anyone who reads this and walks away not in love with Jamie has no heart.

Outlander was the first book in a series of 5, so far.  I literally couldn't put it down.  I've since read all of her books.  Ms. Gabaldon's stories capture the imagination.  I have all of her books in hard cover. Whenever I'm out of fresh reading material, I pull out one of the Outlander series and re-read it.

Outlander is an intoxicating read.  Once started, forget any other plans, for you might just as well have fallen through the stones with Clair. And  Jamie has a way of making any flesh and blood man seem dull in comparison.  This is a compelling love story with more than a smidgen of historical fact  intwined.

I was introduced to these books by a manager of mine when I used to work for a bookstore.  I thought that it wouldn't be for me because of the leangth of it, but I loved the book.  I would recommend it to anyone who would like to read a heart-warming story about two lovers destined to be together.  A must read.
Boring. Predictable. Couldn't even finish it.

Gabaldon manages to weave her story into a tale that grabs the reader's interest and holds it.  The further the reader gets into the novel, the further he wants to go.  Each novel can stand on its own merits, however, I found that one is not enough.  I look forward to each novel in the series with enthusiasm.

A friend loves this book, so I decided to give it a try. I couldn't believe how bad it was--plot driven with embarrassing sex scenes. I call this a young adult novel for older women. The writer would run out of steam and then bring in a sadistic character to torture her main male character. I felt sorry for the poor guy.

I first read this book about 14(yikes) years ago, on a plane on my way to my sister's wedding.  About three copies later, it is still my favorite novel.  It has accompanied me through the beginning stages of labor with my two boys and always gives me the good cry that I need sometimes.  I love this book!!

I tried to like it, but finally gave in to the fact it's simply an outlet for bored women to indulge in complicated erotic fantasy, and have the story explain away how it could be ok to sleep with other men besides your husband. Apparently we're getting so desperate that we're going back in time and sleeping with our husbands ancestors. Craziness.

Fast moving and engaging Outlander is good fluff reading. It is not a heavy nor literary work, but enjoyable non the less. Sometimes we just need to unwind with an outrageous story to wash away the worries of the day. For those times, this type of writing is worthwhile and breaks us out of the ordinary.

After seeing the first episode of the TV show "Outlander", I decided to try the book. It was a fast read and entertaining. Loved the book and I'm curious how they will do with the show. I'm already on the second book in the series and if it's as good as the first, I will be reading all of them!

I absolutely loved this book!!!  It is very descriptive, humorous, romantic, and historical.  There are parts that will make you blush but they are not smutty.  I have to say this is one of my all time favorite books.  I have read Dragonfly in Amber and currently on Voyger and they are all wonderful!!!

I am so addicted to this series of books.  I had never heard of this series until it came on Starz cable recently, so I ordered the first book, and already soooo addicted!  The characters are so real and the storyline is amazing!  I can't wait to see what happens next, but don't want it to end either.

I read the Outlander book as a suggestion from a friend at work.  I have since reread it numerous times.  I have read all the books in the series and LOVED them all.  I can't wait for the next Outlander book.  I normally don't read "romance" books but this one is different.  I highly recommend it!

The characters of Jamie and Claire are so well written as are all the characters. My heart aches for them, leaps for joy with them, and despairs with them. If you haven't seen the Outlander series on Starz, you must see it. Caitronia Balfe and Sam Heughan bring Claire and Jamie to life perfectly!

This is an amazing story that I recommend to all of my friends, just as it was recommended to me (thank you to that friend!). It is an adventure and a love story, with so much history in it and other fascinating tidbits of information. Just a completely wonderful set of books to lose yourself in.

Quite simply the most un-put-downable novel I have ever read. This book defies classification, spans every genre imaginable. Romance, history, science-fiction, mystery, action....You name it and this series has it. Outlander (Cross Stitch) is just the beginning of a beautifully crafted adventure.

The Outlander series is terrific!  I couldn't put it down.  It gave me a chance to lose myself.  Absolutely wonderful. I have reread the series several times, and it keeps getting better.  I recommend this to everyone.  Only word of caution, you won't get anything else done while you are reading these books.

Love tihis book and the entire series. The story is not rushed and rich in detail. As a result, this is one of those books where the characters feel like friends. You can't wait to see what happens in the next book and the next. Diana Galbafon is an excellent story teller. A definite must read!

No exaggeration.  This really is the best historical, romance novel I've read to date:)  You get so involved with the characters.  Diana Gabaldon creates such a visual experience for you and from what I'm guessing, it's historically accurate.  She's a great writer.  PLEASE GIVE THIS BOOK A TRY.
